result.execSummary:
Joseph Paul Yaklich was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Joseph Paul Yaklich was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph Paul Yaklich

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Joshua H. Klaff in court.  Anne Theresa Nack appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Extradited.

Defendant Joseph Paul Yaklich in court in custody with attorney Joshua H. Klaff.  Gwanny J Tjoa appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives rights to extradition.  Further proceedings scheduled for December 9, 2015 at 01:11 pm.
Defendant Joseph P. Yaklich in court in custody with attorney Joshua H. Klaff.  Mark M. Jahnke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Extradition hearing scheduled for November 11, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Joseph P. Yaklich in court in custody with attorney David A. Hart.  Katharine Buker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Body Only ordered.  Extradition hearing scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
